channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Strikes Across Lebanon After Ordering Evacuations of Southern Towns
item.description: The wide-scale bombardment of Lebanon continued a day after a U.S. envoy held talks with Israeli officials on a possible cease-fire with Hezbollah mil...

item.title: Michael O’Leary blasts ‘ancient 1960s law’ as Spain slaps Ryanair with €108 million fine over ‘abusive’ baggage and seating charges
item.description: O'Leary called the fine by Spain's consumer rights ministry "unlawful and baseless" after an appeal was rejected.

item.title: Ukraine Cancels Parliament Session, Citing a Warning Over a Missile Attack
item.description: This is the first time Parliament has canceled a session since Russia invaded Ukraine.

item.title: At COP29, ‘Sewage Beer’ Is Just Fine
item.description: The hoppy pilsner from Singapore, where freshwater is scarce, is part of an effort to promote recycling solutions.

item.title: Prime Minister Trudeau’s government plans to cut sales tax and send checks to millions of Canadians as election looms
item.description: Trudeau’s Liberals trail the opposition Conservatives 39% to 26% in the latest Nanos poll.

item.title: Israel Rally Around Netanyahu Over I.C.C. Warrant, for Now
item.description: An I.C.C. arrest warrant for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu over the war in Gaza spurred outrage across Israel’s political spectrum. But in the lon...

item.title: Bosses: Workers have no clue what you’re talking about when you use these acronyms
item.description: Acronyms to make the list include IRL and WFH—despite the latter dominating workplace conversations for well over four years.

item.title: As Ukraine Fires U.S. Missiles, Putin Sends a Chilling Message
item.description: The Russian leader ominously declares that America risks nuclear war as it expands its aid.

item.title: Trump’s New Pick for Attorney General, and a Surprise Turn in U.S. Drug Deaths
As Ukraine Fires U.S. Missiles, Putin Sends a Chilling Message
item.description: The Russian leader ominously declares that America risks nuclear war as it expands its aid.

item.title: We Wanted a New Republican Party. Trump Delivered.
item.description: Ross Douthat and Reihan Salam had a vision for how Republicans could reclaim the working class. They never expected Trump to fulfill it.

item.title: Under U.S. antitrust fire, Alphabet stock drops 6%
item.description: The prospect of selling Chrome is only part of it.

item.title: HarperCollins strikes AI training deal with unnamed company amid rising copyright tensions between publishers and AI firms
item.description: In the latest development, U.S. publishing giant HarperCollins reached a contract with an unnamed tech company allowing it to use some of its books to...
